key_points: Alec Baldwin will make his first public appearance since the 'Rust' shooting at the 2021 Ripple of Hope Award event.
The Ripple of Hope Award is organized by the Robert F. Kennedy Human Rights organization.
The award honors leaders showing commitment to social change and reflects Robert Kennedyâ€™s values for equality, justice, and human rights.
Stacey Abrams, José E. Feliciano, Amanda Gorman, Deven Parekh, and Hans Vestberg will be honored at the event.
Vice President Kamala Harris will be the keynote speaker.
The event will have a mix of in-person and virtual experiences, held at the New York Hilton Midtown Manhattan Hotel.
Past laureates of the award include Dr. Anthony Fauci and Colin Kaepernick.
Alec Baldwin described the fatal shooting incident during a tell-all interview, stating he did not pull the trigger.
The incident is under investigation to determine how a live round was present in the gun.
Baldwin claims the gun discharged without pulling the trigger while he was being directed on its positioning.
